notes: Complete VAT framework across EU. 15 titles covering scope, territorial application, taxable persons, transactions, place, chargeability, rates, exemptions, deductions, obligations, special schemes, derogations. Minimum standard rate 15%. Foundation for all EU member state VAT systems.

Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive. Interest limitation (30% EBITDA), exit taxation, general anti-abuse rule, controlled foreign company rules, hybrid mismatch provisions. Implementation deadline Dec 31 2018; effective Jan 1 2019.

Country-by-Country Reporting directive. EUR 750M threshold, 12-month filing deadline, automatic exchange between member states within 15 months. Information on revenue, profit/loss, taxes, capital, earnings, employees, assets by jurisdiction.

Tax information exchange between EU member states. Three mechanisms: exchange on request, automatic exchange (5 income categories as of Jan 1 2014), spontaneous exchange. Strict confidentiality safeguards. Central liaison offices coordinate exchange.
Historical reference: Parent-subsidiary dividend taxation (25% ownership threshold). Repealed by Directive 2011/96/EU effective Jan 17 2012. Documents evolution of EU corporate taxation framework.

Core EU accounting requirements. Micro/small/medium/large undertaking classifications with thresholds. Annual financial statement requirements (balance sheet, profit/loss, notes). Going concern, consistency, prudence, accrual basis. Audit requirements with SME exemptions.

Mandatory IFRS for EU public company consolidated financial statements from Jan 1 2005. Defines IASB standards adoption process. Endorsement criteria: true/fair view, public good, understandability, relevance, reliability, comparability. Member state flexibility for annual accounts.

Periodic financial reporting for issuers on regulated markets. Annual reports (4-month deadline), half-yearly reports (2-month deadline), interim management statements. Major holdings disclosure at 5/10/15/20/25/30/50/75% thresholds (4 trading days). Shareholder rights to proxy voting.

Mandatory corporate sustainability reporting. Applies to large undertakings (all), SMEs on regulated markets (except micro), third-country undertakings with significant EU operations. Double materiality framework (financial impacts ON company, impacts OF company). Staggered implementation 2024-2028.

Consumer credit on residential property. Pre-contractual ESIS (European Standardised Information Sheet), creditworthiness assessment, credit intermediary supervision, responsible lending requirements. Currency risk protection for foreign currency loans. 7-day reflection period, early repayment rights.

Cross-border insolvency proceedings framework. Jurisdiction based on centre of main interests (presumed: registered office for companies). Main and secondary proceedings coordination. Applicable law: opening member state law governs. Exceptions for rights in rem, employment, payment systems.

Comprehensive guide for accessing German federal statutes from gesetze-im-internet.de. Documents access methods for Einkommensteuergesetz (EStG), Umsatzsteuergesetz (UStG), Grundbuchordnung (GBO), other P1 sources. Explains table-of-contents limitation and workarounds. Provides direct PDF/HTML/XML download instructions.

Comprehensive guide for accessing French legal codes from Legifrance (HTTP 403 blocking issue). Documents blocked sources: Code Général des Impôts (CGI), Code Civil, Code de Commerce. Provides 5 workaround strategies including manual browser download (recommended). Alternative sources via EU-Lex for harmonized provisions.
